lead_paragraph: When gunmen took over federal land in rural Oregon last week, Daryl Johnson, a former Department of Homeland Security official, was not surprised.

headline.print_headline: Homeland Security ‘Should Be Doing More’ to Fight Militias, a Former Analyst Says
headline.main: Homeland Security Looked Past Antigovernment Movement, Ex-Analyst Says

snippet: When gunmen took over federal land in rural Oregon last week, Daryl Johnson, a former Department of Homeland Security official, was not surprised.
abstract: Daryl Johnson, who worked in now-defunct branch of Dept of Homeland Security that studied threats posed by anti-government militias, says department should be doing more to combat domestic terrorism; issue has returned to fore with takeover of federal wildlife preserve in Oregon.  Johnson feels department should reinstate his department and direct more resources toward monitoring and combating threat of domestic terrorism.
